p: Another genome-wide strategy for biomarker identification is to examine easily accessible tissues of living Parkinson’s patients at an early or prodromal stage in the disease. A study examining drug-naive, sporadic Parkinson’s patients at the onset of motor symptoms found transcriptomic changes in the chromatin remodeling and methylation machineries [ 66]. This suggests that widespread epigenetic differences occur early in PD, prior to pharmacological treatment, and that such differences may be useful biomarkers for prodromal PD cases.
